bill_title: prohibit any school district from transporting students who participate in the enrollment options program beyond the boundaries of that school district.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to prohibit any school district from transporting students who participate in the enrollment options program beyond the boundaries of that school district. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 13-28-45 be amended to read as follows: 13-28-45. The parent or guardian of a student who has been accepted for transfer is responsible for transporting the student to school in the receiving district without reimbursement. Either the district of residence or the receiving district may provide transportation to students approved for transfer. However, no school district may transport any students enrolled under the provisions of § § 13-28-40 to 13-28-47, inclusive, beyond the boundaries of that school district. The provisions of § 13-29-4 do not apply when transporting students enrolled under the provisions of §§ 13-28-40 to 13-28-47. The receiving district may charge a reasonable fee if the student elects to use the transportation services offered by the receiving district.
